result.execSummary:
All charges against Jason R. Smith in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason R. Smith is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason R. Smith

records.addlTxt: 9:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason R. Smith in court. Court calls 22CM35, 22FO92 & 22TR264. Defendant does not qualify for public defender. Statement by defendant's wife. Court recessed 9:47am. Court recalled 9:50am. State moves to dismiss criminal complaint. Court dismisses 22CM35 upon State's motion. Defendant pleads no contest to 22FO92 and 22TR264. Court finds defendant guilty due to no contest plea, orders fines be paid today or 6 months commitment order on 22FO92 and 5 years revocation of license on 22TR264. Adj. 9:53am jjm
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason R. Smith in court. Statement by DA. Court reads criminal complaint. Defendant does not want counsel. Court recessed. Court recalled 9:50am. Statement by Court. Court explains right to attorney. Court advises defendant to contact PD's office. jjm
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
